member.name: M:EasyToolKit.Inspector.Editor.HandlerUtility.GetMatchedType(EasyToolKit.Core.TypeMatchIndex,System.Type[],System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Resolves generic type arguments for inspector elements that target partially open generic types. This method handles complex scenarios where an inspector element's generic parameters correspond to specific type parameters within a partially concrete generic target type.
member.param: The type match index containing the inspector element type and its target generic type.
The target types to match against; expected to contain exactly one type (the actual value type).
Reference parameter that can be set to true to stop further matching (not used in this implementation).
member.returns: If the inspector element's target type is a (partially open) generic type and the actual value type can provide the missing generic arguments, returns the concretely instantiated inspector element type. Otherwise, returns null to indicate no match.

remarks.para: This method enables inspector elements to target complex generic types with mixed concrete and generic type parameters. For example, consider an inspector element type that draws values of a generic collection with a fixed key type:

Here, SerializedDictionaryValueDrawer<TValue> (matchIndex.Type) targets SerializedDictionary<string, TValue> (matchIndex.Targets[0]), which is a partially open generic type with a concrete key type (string) and a generic value type (TValue). The target type is obtained via during initialization: given SerializedDictionaryValueDrawer<TValue> and its base class EasyValueDrawer<SerializedDictionary<string, TValue>>, the method extracts the generic argument SerializedDictionary<string, TValue>.
When the actual value type is SerializedDictionary<string, int> (targets[0]), this method:

item.description: Validates there's exactly one target type and that the element's target is a generic type.
If the target is a completely concrete type (no generic parameters), requires exact type equality.

Otherwise, calls to extract the missing generic arguments: ResolveMissingGenericTypeArguments(SerializedDictionary<string, TValue>, SerializedDictionary<string, int>, false) returns [int], which is the concrete type for the parameter TValue.
If no arguments are missing (types already match or are incompatible), returns null.
Checks that SerializedDictionaryValueDrawer<TValue>'s generic constraints are satisfied by [int] via .
If all checks pass, constructs and returns SerializedDictionaryValueDrawer<int> using .

remarks.para: This mechanism allows inspector elements to be automatically instantiated with the correct type arguments based on the actual runtime type of the property being inspected. It supports complex scenarios with multiple generic parameters, such as KeyValuePairDrawer<TKey, TValue> : EasyValueDrawer<KeyValuePair<int, TKey>> where only a subset of the target type's generic parameters correspond to the drawer's own generic parameters.

member.name: M:EasyToolKit.Inspector.Editor.IElement.Request(System.Action,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Requests an action that modifies the tree structure to be executed safely. If the element is currently drawing, the action is queued and executed after drawing completes. Otherwise, the action is executed immediately unless is true.
member.param: The action to execute that may modify tree structure.
If true, forces the action to be queued and executed after drawing completes, even if not currently drawing. If false, executes immediately when not drawing.
member.remarks: Use this method for operations that add, remove, or move elements to prevent modifying the tree during the drawing phase, which would cause rendering inconsistencies.

member.summary: Gets the collection of parameter elements for this method.

member.summary: Method parameter element interface representing individual parameters in methods. As an abstract parameter element concept, supports parameter value handling for method invocation.

member.summary: Gets the method parameter definition that describes this parameter.

member.name: P:EasyToolKit.Inspector.Editor.IMethodParameterElement.LogicalParent
member.summary: Gets the logical parent method element that contains this parameter.

member.summary: Gets the property collection definition that describes this property collection.

member.name: T:EasyToolKit.Inspector.Editor.IPropertyElement
member.summary: Property element interface representing properties on an object. Handles display and editing of .

member.name: P:EasyToolKit.Inspector.Editor.IPropertyElement.Definition
member.summary: Gets the property definition that describes this property.

member.name: T:EasyToolKit.Inspector.Editor.IRootElement
member.summary: Root element interface for the inspector tree. An abstract concept similar to dynamically created values, representing the root Unity instance being inspected.

member.name: P:EasyToolKit.Inspector.Editor.IRootElement.Definition
member.summary: Gets the root definition that describes this root element.

member.name: T:EasyToolKit.Inspector.Editor.IValueElement
member.summary: Value element interface for all data-containing elements. Can represent fields, properties, or dynamically created custom values, and supports independent insertion into the element tree.

member.name: P:EasyToolKit.Inspector.Editor.IValueElement.Definition
member.summary: Gets the value definition that describes this value element.

member.name: P:EasyToolKit.Inspector.Editor.IValueElement.LogicalChildren
member.summary: Gets the child elements defined by the code structure. These are immutable and determined solely by the definition.

remarks.para: Returns null for plain value types, for references, or when is true.

member.name: P:EasyToolKit.Inspector.Editor.IValueElement.Children
member.summary: Gets child elements that were added or removed at runtime (e.g., by user interaction). This collection is mutable and reflects runtime modifications.

remarks.para: Returns null for plain value types, for references, or when is true.

member.name: P:EasyToolKit.Inspector.Editor.IValueElement.BaseValueEntry
member.summary: Gets the base value entry that is built directly from . This represents the declared type of the value.

member.name: P:EasyToolKit.Inspector.Editor.IValueElement.ValueEntry
member.summary: Gets the value entry that manages the underlying value storage and change notifications. This is built based on the runtime type of the value in .

remarks.para: When the runtime type equals the declared type, this is the same as .
When the runtime type is a derived type, this is a type wrapper around .

member.name: T:EasyToolKit.Inspector.Editor.ICollectionConfiguration
member.summary: Configuration interface for creating collection element definitions. Collections represent data structures like arrays, lists, and dictionaries that contain multiple elements.

member.name: P:EasyToolKit.Inspector.Editor.ICollectionConfiguration.ItemType
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of elements contained in this collection. For dictionaries, this represents the type of values.

member.name: P:EasyToolKit.Inspector.Editor.ICollectionConfiguration.IsOrdered
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this collection is ordered (can be accessed by index). Ordered collections include arrays, lists, and other indexable sequences. Unordered collections include sets, dictionaries, and other non-indexable collections.

member.name: M:EasyToolKit.Inspector.Editor.ICollectionConfiguration.CreateDefinition
member.summary: Creates a new instance based on the current configuration.
member.returns: A new collection definition instance.

member.summary: Configuration interface for creating collection item element definitions. Collection items represent individual elements within collections (lists, arrays).

member.name: M:EasyToolKit.Inspector.Editor.ICollectionItemConfiguration.CreateDefinition
member.summary: Creates a new instance based on the current configuration.
member.returns: A new collection item definition instance.

member.name: T:EasyToolKit.Inspector.Editor.PostProcessorChain
member.summary: Represents a chain of post processors that can be iterated over during element processing. This class implements both and interfaces to allow sequential iteration through post processors while automatically skipping post processors that should be skipped during the processing.

member.name: P:EasyToolKit.Inspector.Editor.PostProcessorChain.Current
member.summary: Gets the current post processor in the iteration. Returns null if the iteration is before the first post processor or after the last post processor.

member.name: P:EasyToolKit.Inspector.Editor.PostProcessorChain.PostProcessors
member.summary: Gets all post processors in this chain, including those that may be skipped during iteration.

member.name: P:EasyToolKit.Inspector.Editor.PostProcessorChain.Element
member.summary: Gets the inspector element associated with this post processor chain.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The inspector element this post processor chain is associated with.
The collection of post processors to include in the chain.

member.name: M:EasyToolKit.Inspector.Editor.PostProcessorChain.MoveNext
member.summary: Advances the enumerator to the next post processor in the chain.
member.returns: true if the enumerator was successfully advanced to the next post processor; false if the enumerator has passed the end of the collection.

member.name: M:EasyToolKit.Inspector.Editor.PostProcessorChain.Reset
member.summary: Sets the enumerator to its initial position, which is before the first post processor in the chain.

member.name: M:EasyToolKit.Inspector.Editor.PostProcessorChain.GetEnumerator
member.summary: Returns an enumerator that iterates through all post processors in the chain.
member.returns: An enumerator that can be used to iterate through all post processors.

member.summary: Returns an enumerator that iterates through all post processors in the chain.
member.returns: An enumerator that can be used to iterate through all post processors.

member.name: M:EasyToolKit.Inspector.Editor.PostProcessorChain.System#IDisposable#Dispose
member.summary: Performs application-defined tasks associated with freeing, releasing, or resetting unmanaged resources. Resets the enumerator position.

member.name: T:EasyToolKit.Inspector.Editor.PostProcessorPriorityAttribute
member.summary: Attribute used to specify the priority of a post processor. This attribute can be applied to post processor classes to control their execution order in the post processor chain. Higher priority post processors are executed before lower priority post processors.

member.summary: Represents the lowest possible post processor priority.

member.summary: Represents the standard priority for validation post processors.

member.summary: Represents the priority for cleanup post processors.

member.summary: Represents the highest standard post processor priority.

member.summary: Gets the priority value for the post processor.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The priority value for the post processor..

member.name: T:EasyToolKit.Inspector.Editor.PostProcessorPriorityLevel
member.summary: Provides standard priority levels for post processors. These constants define the standard priority ranges used by different types of post processors. Higher values indicate higher priority (executed earlier in the post processor chain).

member.summary: The lowest priority level for post processors that should execute last.
